content: How can I help you today?
I’m not really sure. My wife pushed me into this, so I guess I’m here to talk about my family and what’s been going on. It’s just been a lot lately, and I don’t even know where to start.

Thank you for being open to sharing. It sounds like there's a lot happening in your life right now, and it might feel overwhelming to figure out where to begin. If it’s okay with you, maybe we could just start wherever you feel comfortable—whether that's about your family, your feelings, or what’s been going on lately. What feels most important to talk about right now?

I guess what's been weighing on me the most is my son. He's been struggling with behavioral issues, and no matter what we try, my wife and I can't seem to help him. It's been tough for all of us, and it's not only affecting him but our marriage and even how much I’m able to be there for my daughter. I feel stuck, like I’m failing as a parent and a husband.

That sounds like a really heavy load to be carrying. It’s clear how much you care about your family and want to support your son, your wife, and your daughter, even though you’re feeling stuck right now. Balancing all of that—your son’s struggles, your marriage, and being there for your daughter—sounds exhausting and overwhelming. What’s been the hardest part of all of this for you?

I think the hardest part is feeling like no matter what we do, nothing gets better. My wife and I end up arguing about how to handle things, and then I feel guilty because I know my daughter is missing out on having both parents fully present. It’s like I’m failing on all fronts—at work, with my wife, my kids, even myself. I just don’t know what to do anymore.

It sounds so painful to feel like you're putting in effort but not seeing the changes you hope for. On top of that, there’s the strain in your marriage and the sense of being pulled in so many different directions, leaving you feeling stretched too thin and uncertain. It really shows how much you care about your family, even while you're struggling with these feelings of guilt and frustration. What keeps you going, even in the middle of all this?

Honestly, I think it’s just that I want my family to be okay. I want to help my son, be a better husband, and make sure my daughter doesn’t feel left out. Even if it feels like things are falling apart, I don’t want to give up on them. That’s what keeps me going.

Your commitment to your family really shines through. Despite how difficult things feel right now, you’re holding onto that hope and determination to support them and make things better. That takes a lot of strength. It also sounds like your love for them is what keeps you grounded, even when you're feeling overwhelmed. What do you think would need to happen for things to start feeling a little more manageable?

I guess if we could figure out how to help my son, that might take some pressure off everything else. It feels like his struggles are the center of everything going wrong. But honestly, I don’t even know where to begin with that—it just feels so big and out of my control.

It makes sense that focusing on helping your son feels like a good place to start, especially if his struggles seem to be affecting so much. At the same time, it sounds like the situation feels really daunting and hard to navigate—like you’re not sure what steps to take or how to approach it. What has made you feel most supported or hopeful, even in small moments, when working on this before?

Honestly... I don’t know if anything has made me feel hopeful. We've tried different things—talking to him, changing our approach to discipline, even looking into resources online. But nothing seems to stick, and it just feels like we’re spinning our wheels. It’s hard to see where this could ever get better.

It sounds so disheartening to feel like you’ve been trying different approaches and yet not seeing the changes you hoped for. You’ve put in energy and care, and even though it's not paying off yet, that effort shows how deeply you’re invested in helping your son and your family. Even if things feel overwhelming right now, just the fact that you’re here, talking about it, shows you’re not giving up. What do you think keeps you pushing forward, even when it feels like progress is so hard to find?

Honestly, I think it’s just that I care too much to throw in the towel. I love my family, and as much as I’m struggling, I just want them to be okay. I don’t know how to fix things, but I guess some part of me is still hoping there’s a way. That’s why I’m even doing this, despite feeling unsure about it.

That hope and dedication you have for your family are really powerful. Even in the middle of uncertainty and struggle, you’re showing up and investing in ways to move forward. It’s clear how much your love and commitment drive you, even when the path forward feels unclear or overwhelming. Is there anything else today that you’d like to talk about or explore before thinking about next steps?
I think that’s all for now. Thanks for talking with me about all this. I’m still not sure where this is going, but I’ll think about what we’ve talked about. I appreciate it.
